greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: In the ranked poset of integer partitions ordered by refinement, number of integer partitions coarser (greater) than or equal to the integer partition with Heinz number n.
comment: The Heinz number of an integer partition (y_1, ..., y_k) is prime(y_1) * ... * prime(y_k).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65536
example: The a(24) = 6 partitions coarser than or equal to (2111) are (2111), (311), (221), (32), (41), (5), with Heinz numbers 24, 20, 18, 15, 14, 11.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Jul 22 2018
